page.title: 15TRANSPORT IN A-J-M.
page.content: The area is bounded East and West by {roads}and one runs North-South through the region.They carry mainly light, local traffic.There are smaller lanes and many farms have long,tarmaced drives{The Shropshire Union canal}runs West to North-west and is used increas ingly by holiday traffic,purpose built narrow boats and cabin cruisers.These are usually family holidays of one or two weeks duration.The canal has one lock,Minshull lock,along its length & is increasingly well maintained by British Waterways Board.It is used by many fishermen.The{Crewe-Chester {British Rail line}skirts through the S.W.corner of the area.{Footpaths}are hard to find,but passable and little used.Footbridges and stiles are in position.
